title: Geocode Brazilian Addresses with CNEFE
text: geocodebr package enables one geocode Brazilian addresses using National Registry Addresses Statistical Purposes (english Cadastro Nacional de Endereços para Fins Estatísticos, CNEFE). CNEFE published Brazilian official statistics geography office, IBGE.

title: Geocode Brazilian Addresses with CNEFE
text: package yet CRAN. can install development version :
code: # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("ipeaGIT/geocodebr")

title: Geocode Brazilian Addresses with CNEFE
text: Soon.

title: Geocode Brazilian Addresses with CNEFE

what: Download the CNEFE data set — download_cnefe
title: Download the CNEFE data set — download_cnefe
text: Downloads enriched version CNEFE (National Registry Addresses Statistical Purposes, portuguese) data set, purposefully built used package.

title: Download the CNEFE data set — download_cnefe
code: download_cnefe(state = "all", progress = TRUE, cache = TRUE)

title: Download the CNEFE data set — download_cnefe
text: state character vector. states whose CNEFE data downloaded. Either "" (default), case data states downloaded, vector states abbreviations (e.g. c("RJ", "DF") download data Rio de Janeiro Federal District). progress logical. Whether display download progress bar. Defaults TRUE. cache Logical. Whether function read data cached locally, much faster. Defaults TRUE. first time user runs function, geocodebr download CNEFE data store locally data needs download . FALSE, function download data overwrite local files.

title: Download the CNEFE data set — download_cnefe
text: Invisibly returns path file data saved.

title: Download the CNEFE data set — download_cnefe
code: download_cnefe(state = "AC", progress = FALSE)  download_cnefe(state = c("AC", "AL"), progress = FALSE)

what: Geocoding addresses based on CNEFE data — geocode
title: Geocoding addresses based on CNEFE data — geocode
text: Takes data frame containing addresses input returns spatial coordinates found based CNEFE data.

title: Geocoding addresses based on CNEFE data — geocode
code: geocode(   input_table,   logradouro = NULL,   numero = NULL,   complemento = NULL,   cep = NULL,   bairro = NULL,   municipio = NULL,   estado = NULL,   progress = TRUE,   output_simple = TRUE,   ncores = NULL,   cache = TRUE )

title: Geocoding addresses based on CNEFE data — geocode
text: input_table data frame. logradouro string. numero string. complemento string. cep string. bairro string. municipio string. estado string. progress Logical. Defaults TRUE display progress bar. includes progress bar downloading CNEFE well processing data records. output_simple Logic. Defaults TRUE ncores Numeric. number cores used parallel execution. Defaults number available cores minus 1. cache Logical. Whether function read data cached locally, much faster. Defaults TRUE. first time user runs function, geocodebr download CNEFE data store locally data needs download . FALSE, function download data overwrite local files.

title: Geocoding addresses based on CNEFE data — geocode
text: arrow Dataset "data.frame" object.

title: Geocoding addresses based on CNEFE data — geocode
code: # open input data data_path <- system.file("extdata/sample_1.csv", package = "geocodebr") input_df <- read.csv(data_path)  # df <- geocodebr::geocode( #   input_table = input_df, #   logradouro = "nm_logradouro", #   numero = "Numero", #   complemento = "Complemento", #   cep = "Cep", #   bairro = "Bairro", #   municipio = "nm_municipio", #   estado = "nm_uf" #   )

what: geocodebr: Geocode Brazilian Addresses with CNEFE — geocodebr
title: geocodebr: Geocode Brazilian Addresses with CNEFE — geocodebr
text: Enables one geocode Brazilian addresses reverse geocode spatial coordinates using National Registry Addresses Statistical Purposes (english Cadastro Nacional de Endereços para Fins Estatísticos, - CNEFE). CNEFE published Brazilian official statistics geography office, IBGE (https://www.ibge.gov.br/estatisticas/sociais/populacao/38734-cadastro-nacional-de-enderecos-para-fins-estatisticos.html).

title: geocodebr: Geocode Brazilian Addresses with CNEFE — geocodebr
text: Maintainer: Daniel Herszenhut dhersz@gmail.com (ORCID) Authors: Rafael H. M. Pereira (ORCID) contributors: Ipea - Institute Applied Economic Research [copyright holder, funder]

title: Get the cache directory used in geocodebr — get_cache_dir
text: Gets directory used cache CNEFE data. Useful inspect directory set set_cache_dir() previous R session. Returns default cache directory custom directory previously set.

text: Lists data saved inside cached directory.

text: print_tree logical. Whether print contents cache directory tree-like format. Defaults FALSE.

text: path cached data.

title: List cached data — list_cached_data
code: list_cached_data() #> [1] "/home/runner/.cache/R/geocodebr/data_release_v0.1.0/estado=AC/part-0.parquet" #> [2] "/home/runner/.cache/R/geocodebr/data_release_v0.1.0/estado=AL/part-0.parquet"  list_cached_data(print_tree = TRUE) #> /home/runner/.cache/R/geocodebr/data_release_v0.1.0 #> ├── estado=AC #> │   └── part-0.parquet #> └── estado=AL #>     └── part-0.parquet #> [1] "/home/runner/.cache/R/geocodebr/data_release_v0.1.0/estado=AC/part-0.parquet" #> [2] "/home/runner/.cache/R/geocodebr/data_release_v0.1.0/estado=AL/part-0.parquet"

what: Reverse geocoding coordinates based on CNEFE data — reverse_geocode
title: Reverse geocoding coordinates based on CNEFE data — reverse_geocode
text: Takes data frame containing coordinates (latitude longitude) returns  address CNEFE closest input coordinates. Latitude longitude inputs limited possible values. Latitudes must -90 90 longitudes must -180 180.

title: Reverse geocoding coordinates based on CNEFE data — reverse_geocode
code: reverse_geocode(input_table, progress = TRUE, ncores = NULL, cache = TRUE)

title: Reverse geocoding coordinates based on CNEFE data — reverse_geocode
text: input_table data frame. must contain columns 'id', 'lon', 'lat' progress Logical. Defaults TRUE display progress bar. includes progress bar downloading CNEFE well processing data records. ncores Numeric. number cores used parallel execution. Defaults number available cores minus 1. cache Logical. Whether function read data cached locally, much faster. Defaults TRUE. first time user runs function, geocodebr download CNEFE data store locally data needs download . FALSE, function download data overwrite local files.

title: Reverse geocoding coordinates based on CNEFE data — reverse_geocode
text: "data.frame" object.

title: Reverse geocoding coordinates based on CNEFE data — reverse_geocode
code: # input data df_coords <- data.frame(   id = 1:6,   lon = c(-67.83112, -67.83559, -67.81918, -43.47110, -51.08934, -67.8191),   lat = c(-9.962392, -9.963436, -9.972736, -22.695578, -30.05981, -9.97273) )  # reverse geocode # df_addresses <- geocodebr::reverse_geocode( #   input_table = df_coords, #   progress = TRUE #   )

what: Set the cache directory used in geocodebr — set_cache_dir
title: Set the cache directory used in geocodebr — set_cache_dir
text: Sets directory used cache CNEFE data. configuration persistent across different R sessions.

title: Set the cache directory used in geocodebr — set_cache_dir
code: set_cache_dir(path = NULL)

title: Set the cache directory used in geocodebr — set_cache_dir
text: path string. path directory used cache data. NULL (default), package use versioned directory saved inside directory returned tools::R_user_dir().

title: Set the cache directory used in geocodebr — set_cache_dir
text: Invisibly returns cache directory path.

title: Set the cache directory used in geocodebr — set_cache_dir
code: set_cache_dir(tempdir()) #> ℹ Setting cache directory to /tmp/Rtmpb4OdMh.  # back to default set_cache_dir(NULL) #> ℹ Setting cache directory to #>   /home/runner/.cache/R/geocodebr/data_release_v0.1.0.

what: Specify the columns describing the address fields — setup_address_fields
title: Specify the columns describing the address fields — setup_address_fields
text: Creates character vector specifying columns represent address field addresses table.

title: Specify the columns describing the address fields — setup_address_fields
code: setup_address_fields(   logradouro = NULL,   numero = NULL,   complemento = NULL,   cep = NULL,   bairro = NULL,   municipio = NULL,   estado = NULL )

title: Specify the columns describing the address fields — setup_address_fields
text: logradouro string. name column representing logradouro (street address) address. May NULL field specified addresses table. numero string. name column representing street number address. May NULL field specified addresses table. complemento string. name column representing complemento (additional information apartment, PO box, etc) address. May NULL field specified addresses table. cep string. name column representing CEP (ZIP code) address. May NULL field specified addresses table. bairro string. name column representing neighborhood address. May NULL field specified addresses table. municipio string. name column representing city address. May NULL field specified addresses table. estado string. name column representing state address. May NULL field specified addresses table.

title: Specify the columns describing the address fields — setup_address_fields
text: character vector names address fields values columns represent addresses table.

title: Specify the columns describing the address fields — setup_address_fields
code: setup_address_fields(   logradouro = "Nome_logradouro",   numero = "Numero",   complemento = "Comp",   cep = "CEP",   bairro = "Bairro",   municipio = "Cidade",   estado = "UF" ) #>        logradouro            numero       complemento               cep  #> "Nome_logradouro"          "Numero"            "Comp"             "CEP"  #>            bairro         municipio            estado  #>          "Bairro"          "Cidade"              "UF"
